Combine a sequence with another:<div>a = [11, 45, 19]<br />b = [22, 37]</div>	<div>a+b # new object</div>[11, 45, 19, 22, 37]<div><br /></div>a += b # a extended by b	python
round() can take 1 or 2 parameters. Explain.<div>n =&nbsp;2.39393</div>	<div>round(n)<br />2.0</div><div><br /></div><div>round(a) will round a to 0 decimal places.</div><div>the number returned is still a float</div><div><br /></div><div>round(n,2)</div><div><!--anki-->2.39</div><div>round(a,b) will round a to b decimal places.</div>	python

How to iterate through the key value pairs of a dictionary?<div>colors = {'blue':(0,0,255), 'red':(255,0,0)}</div>	for k, v in colors.items():<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; print('{}-{}' .format(k, v))<br /><br />blue - (0, 0, 255)<br />red - (255, 0, 0)	python

How to slice all elements from a sequence except the first and last?<div>l = [12, - 23, -55, -88, -19, 45]</div>	l[1:-1]<br />[-23,- 55, -88, -19]	python
What slice notation would return the entire sequence?<div>l = [12, 23, 19, 45]</div>	l[:]<br />[12, 23, 19, 45]<br />this is useful for copying a sequence	python
How to slice the odd subscripted elements of a sequence?<div>s = [13, 43, 29, 11, 99, 37, 55, 17]</div>	s[1::2]<br />[43, 11, 37, 17]<br />	python
s = [13, 43, 29, 11, 99, 37, 55, 17]<br />Get every third element	<div>S[::3]</div>[13, 11, 55]<br />S[i:j:k] returns the elements of the sequence from i to j using step size k	python

Given some sequence S:<br>What is the difference between S.pop(), S.pop(0) and S.pop(-1) <br>and what sequence types can pop be used with?	S.pop() and S.pop(-1) are equivalent.<br>They both remove and return the last element of S.<br>S.pop(0) removes and returns the first element of S.<br>pop() can only be used with mutable sequences such as lists.<br>pop() cannot be used with immutable sequences such as strings or tuples.	python

Name 2 ways to reverse the order of the elements of this list?<br />l = &nbsp;[10, 44, 29, 30, 12, 99]<br /><br />	<div>l[::-1] &nbsp;# works for all objects; harder to read, doesn't change object</div><div><br /></div><div>l.reverse() &nbsp;# works for iterable objects; easy to read, changes object</div><div><br /></div>	python
Ccreate a sublist consisting of the elements of a list wich&nbsp;are evenly divisible by 6?&nbsp;<div><br /></div><div>l = [4, 6, 18, 32, 24, 20, 42, 16, 54, 96, 112]</div><div><br /></div><div>1. Use list comprehsion</div><div><br /></div><div>2. Use filter</div>	<div>1.&nbsp;[i for i in l if i % 6 == 0]&nbsp;#=&gt;&nbsp;[6, 18, 24, 42, 54, 96]</div><div><br /></div><div>2. filter(lambda x: x % 6 == 0, l) #=&gt;&nbsp;[6, 18, 24, 42, 54, 96]</div>	python

Example of how to select elements with a specific attribute and its value ending with a specific string	"$('a[href$="".pdf""]')"	attribute selectors
Example of how to select elements with a specific attribute and part of its value matching a specific string	"$('a[href*=""/path/""]')"	attribute selectors

Method for selecting the first item from a set of matched elements	$('.foo').first()	DOM_traversal_methods
Method for selecting the last item from a set of matched elements	$('.foo').last()	DOM_traversal_methods

Method for selecting all the parents of the elements in the matched set	$('.foo').parents()	DOM_traversal_methods
Method for selecting all ancestors of the elements in the matched set up to but not including the element that is matched by the selector	$('.foo').parentsUntil('.bar')	DOM_traversal_methods
Method for selecting the ancestor that is the nearest to the selected element and matches some selector	$('.foo').closest('.bar')	DOM_traversal_methods

Method for selecting siblings in a matched set	$('foo').siblings()	DOM_traversal_methods
Method for selecting the previous sibling of all elements in the matched set	$('.foo').prev()	DOM_traversal_methods
Method for selecting all previous siblings of the elements in the matched set	$('.foo').prevAll()	DOM_traversal_methods

Method for selecting the following sibling of all elements in the matched set	$('.foo').next()	DOM_traversal_methods
Method to add more elements to a matched set	$('.foo').add('.bar')

Method for attaching one handler to multiple events	$('.foo').bind('click focus blur', function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('bar');<br />});	events
How to attach code to multiple events in one go?	$('.foo').bind('mouseenter mouseleave', function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('bar');<br />});	events
How to pass a variable to an event handler by value instead of by variable	var message = 'Spoon!';<br>$('#foo').bind('click', <b>{msg: message}</b>, function(event) {<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.data.msg);<br>});<br>message = 'Not in the face!';<br>$('#bar').bind('click', <b>{msg: message}</b>, function(event) {<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.data.msg);<br>});	events
How to namespace events?	"$('.foo').bind('click.name', function() {<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('User clicked on ""foo.""');<br>});<br>"	events
Why namespacing events?	In order to unbind a function in an event, leaving other functions in that event in place	events
Name all properties of the event object that are passed along with every function in an event	$('.foo').bind('click', function(event) {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.target)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.relatedTarget)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.which)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.pageX)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.pageY)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.result)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(event.timeStamp)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;event.preventDefault()<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;event.stopPropagation()<br />});	events
Define event.relatedTarget	The relatedTarget is the other element that's involved in the event, if any. For example: when a mouseout is triggered, relatedTarget is the element being entered, but during a mousein, it is the element being exited.	events
Define event.which	It indicates which key or button is pressed during key or button events.	events
Method for removing events	$('.foo').unbind('click')<br />or<br />$('.foo').unbind('click', handler)<br>or<br>$('.foo').unbind('click.bar')	events
How to unbind multiple named events in one go	$('.foo').bind('click.bar', someFunction)<br />$('.foo').bind('click.baz', someFunction)<br />$('.foo').unbind('click.bar.baz')	events
Method for adding an event that is triggered only once	$('.foo').one('click', function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('bar')<br />})	events
Method for triggering all event code and the default behavior of an element	$('.foo').trigger('click')	Events
Execute all events (not the behaviours) attached to an element for an event.	$('.foo').triggerHandler('click')	events
Name 4 things that are different between trigger() and triggerHandler().	- .triggerHandler() does not trigger the default behavior of an event (such as a form submission).<br>- .trigger() will operate on all matched elements, .triggerHandler() only affects the first matched element.<br>- Events created with .triggerHandler() do not bubble up the DOM hierarchy.<br>- Instead of returning the jQuery object (to allow chaining), .triggerHandler() returns whatever value was returned by the last handler it caused to be executed. If no handlers are triggered, it returns undefined<br>	events
Method for attaching a handler to an event for all elements which match the current selector during the whole lifetime of the page	$('.foo').live('click', function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('bar')<br />});	events
Two Differences between .live() and .bind()	- DOM traversal methods are not fully supported for finding elements to send to .live(). Rather, the .live() method should always be called directly after a selector.<br />- To stop further handlers from executing after one bound using .live(), the handler must return false. Calling .stopPropagation() will not accomplish this.	events
Remove all event handlers previously attached using .live() from the elements	"$("".foo"").die()<br />or<br />$("".foo"").die(""click"")"	events
How to unbind an event that has been created with live()	"var foo = function () {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('bar')<br />}<br />$(""p"").live(""click"", foo)<br />$(""p"").<b>die</b>(""click"", foo)"	events
How to run code after the DOM is fully loaded	$(document).ready(function() {<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('DOM loaded')<br>})	events
How to execute some code in case an image is not loaded	$('img.foo').error(function() {<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('image not loaded')<br>})	events
The simplest way to create a doubleclick event	$('.foo').dblclick(functionName)	events
How to bind two or more handlers to the matched elements, to be executed on alternate clicks	$('.foo').toggle(<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('1');<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;},<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('2');<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;},<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alert('3');<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;}<br />)	events
Switch between displaying and hiding an element	$('.foo').toggle()	Animation
Difference between mouseover and mouseenter	They differ in event bubbling. With mouseover, the event is also triggered by descendents of the item with the event. The mouseenter event only triggers its handler when the mouse enters the element it is bound to.	events
The opposite of .mouseenter() is	.mouseleave()	events
Set the mouseenter and mouseleave event in one go.	$('.foo').hover(<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;function() { alert('mouseenter') }, <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;function() { alert('mouseleave') }<br />)<br />	events
Bind an event handler to track the movement of the mouse cursor or place that event on some element.	$('.foo').mousemove(function(event) {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;$('#log').html('x: '+ event.pageX + ', y: '+ event.pageY)<br />})	events
How to submit a form with jQuery	"$(""form:first"").submit()"	events
How to detect that a page or an element is being scrolled	$('.foo').scroll(function() {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;$('.log').append('&lt;div&gt;Scroll&lt;/div&gt;')<br />})	events
Simplest way to show a hidden element with an animation that uses width, height and opacity	$('.foo').show(500);<br />	Animation
What is event.result?	An event attribute that contains the last value returned by an event handler that was triggered by this event, unless the value was undefined. 	events
Animate to some specific opacity level.	$('.foo').fadeTo(100, 0.8)	Animation
Method for making a custom animations instead of using predefined animations like fadeIn() and slideUp()	$('#book').animate(<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;{<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;left: '+=50',<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;height: 'toggle'<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;},<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;5000,<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;function() { alert('callback') }<br />)	Animation
Stop the current animation	$('.foo').stop()	Animation
How to stop an animation, clear the queue and complete the current animation immediately	var clearQueue = true<br />var jumpToEnd= true<br />$('.foo').stop(clearQueue, jumpToEnd)	Animation
How to delay execution of subsequent items in the queue.	"$('.foo').slideUp(300).<b>delay</b>(800, ""fx"").fadeIn(400)"	Animation
Method for executing the next function in the queue and remove it from the queue list	"$(""button"").click(function () {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;$(""div"").animate({top:'0px'}, 600)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;$(""div"").queue(function () {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$(this).toggleClass(""red"")<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$(this).<b>dequeue</b>()<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;})<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;$(""div"").animate({left:'10px', top:'30px'}, 700)<br />})"	Animation
Find the index number of an element relative to its siblings	$('li.foo').index()	Methods
Example of a way to iterate through both arrays and objects.	var obj = {<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;'fooKey': 'fooValue', <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;'barKey': 'barValue'<br />}<br />$.<b>each</b>(obj, function(key, value) { <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;alert(key + ': ' + value)<br />})	Methods

"var arr = [ 1, 9, 3, 8, 6, 1, 5 ]<br />arr = jQuery.<b>grep</b>(arr, function(item, index){<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;return (item != 5 &amp;&amp; index &gt; 4)<br />})<br />alert(arr.join("", ""))<br />"	Methods

How Python groups pieces of code to be processed together.	Indentation

Used to set or assign a value.	=					
Used to test for equality.	==					
File extension used for Python source code.	.py					
Press to run programs in the Python shell.	F5					
Used for making single line comments which are ignored by the Interpreter.	#

Addition operator.	+					
x is being assigned the value of 5.	x = 5					
Test if x is equal to 5.	x == 5					
x is less than y	x &lt; y					
X is greater than y	x &gt; y					
x is less than or equal to 5.	x &lt;= 5					
x is greater than or equal to 5.	x &gt;= 5					
x is not equal to 5.	x != 5

A classification for data i.e. string, integer, floating point number etc.  Determines possible values and what you can do with that data.	Data Type					
A whole number.  No decimal point.  3, 25, 89 etc.	Integer					
A number with a decimal point.  5.67, 2.456  etc.	Float					
Converts data to floating point numbers.	float()					
An Instruction.  Frequently added on to other commands or variables and connected with a period/full-stop i.e. text.upper()  or print(msg.upper())	Method					
A bunch of prewritten code that you can import and use in your own program.	Library					
A series of characters.	string					
The 2 pieces of info a computer uses to keep track of the characters in a string.	Start and Offset					
Returns a single character (index value 15) from string s.	s[15]					
Returns a group of characters (substring) from within larger string s, starting with character at index position 124 and up to (but not including) character at position 132.	s[124:132]					
A string within a string.	substring<div><br /></div><div>&nbsp;Substrings are specified using 2 index values i.e. s[3:5]</div>					
Converts string s to UPPERCASE.	s.upper()

When you have more code than you actually need.  Often caused by Duplication.	Code Bloat					
When you copy/paste sections of the same code rather than creating a single function. Bad Practice.	Duplication					
A piece of code that you define and separate out from the rest, and call into use as needed.	Function					
Keyword used to define a new Function before you use it.&nbsp;	def<div><br /></div><div>Example: def new_function():</div>					
Returns a value back to the code that called the function.	return()					
A section of the computer&#39;s memory. Similar to a note pad.	Stack					
A section of the Stack - similar to a sheet of paper on a note pad.	Stack Frame					
Its stack frames and local variables are thrown away.	When you leave a function:					
When a variable&#39;s value can&#39;t be seen by some code (because it&#39;s on a different stack frame)	Out of Scope					
The context in which a variable is in effect.	Scope					
A variable that is accessable in every scope i.e. anywhere in the program.	Global Variable					
A variable that is only accessable from the function or block in which it is declared.	Local Variable					
By placing them between parentheses.	You can pass Parameters to functions:

M = L	# M and L reference the same object

What is a virtual function?	<div>A virtual function or virtual method is a function or method whose behavior can be overridden within an inheriting class by a function with the same signature.&nbsp;</div><div><br /></div>In Python methods are better than virtual - they're completely dynamic, as the typing in Python is duck typing.	
<div>Get every other item, starting with 2nd item</div><div><br /></div><div>foo = range(100,151)</div>	foo[1::2]

recursion	call the same function again<div><br /></div><div>You can -</div><div><div>def function():</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; return value</div></div><div><br /></div><div>Therefore -</div><div><div>def function():</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; return another_function()</div></div><div><br /></div><div>Therefore -&nbsp;</div><div><div>def function():</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; return function()</div></div><div><br /></div>

try/except	Catch and recover from exceptions raised by Python, or by you.	
try/finally	Perform cleanup actions, whether exceptions occur or not.	
raise	Trigger an exception manually in your code.	
assert	Conditionally trigger an exception in your code.	
with/as	Implement context managers&nbsp;

WHAT IS __INIT__.PY?	<div>It is used to import a module in a directory, called package import.</div><div><br /></div><div>If we have a module, dir1/dir2/mod.py, we put __init__.py in each directories. So, we can import the mod like this:&nbsp;import dir1.dir2.mod</div><div><br /></div><div>The __init__.py is usually an empty py file. The hierarchy gives us a convenient way of organizing the files in a large system.</div>

LEGB Rule	scope<div><br /></div><div><b>L</b>ocal. (Names assigned in any way within a function (def or lambda)), and not declared global in that function.</div><div><div><br /></div><div><b>E</b>nclosing function locals. (Name in the local scope of any and all enclosing functions (def or lambda), form inner to outer.</div><div><br /></div><div><b>G</b>lobal (module). Names assigned at the top-level of a module file, or declared global in a def within the file.</div><div><br /></div><div><b>B</b>uilt-in (Python). Names preassigned in the built-in names module : open,range,SyntaxError,...</div></div>

hash	"<div>Return a hash value for the object. &nbsp;</div><div><br /></div><div>Two objects with the same value have&nbsp;the same hash value. &nbsp;The reverse is not necessarily true, but likely.</div><div><br /></div><div>hash(42)</div><div>42</div><div><br /></div><div><div>hash(""Hello, world!"")</div><div>-943387004357456228</div></div>"	
"Implement the Bunch design pattern<div><br /></div><div><div>employee = Bunch(name=""Jayne Cobb"", position=""Senior Engineer"")</div><div>employee.name #=&gt; 'Jayne Cobb'</div></div>"	"<div><div>class Bunch:</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;""Bunch is a dictionary that supports attribute-style access, a la JavaScript.""</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; def __init__(self, **kwargs):</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; self.__dict__.update(kwargs)</div></div>"	
"<div>print vowels in ""powerful"" on one line</div><div>vowels = 'aeiouy'</div>"	<div>[letter for letter in 'powerful' if letter in vowels]</div><div><br /></div><div>for letterin 'powerful':</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; if letterin vowels:</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; print(letter),</div><div><br /></div><div><div>['o', 'e', 'u']</div></div>

<div>Find all elements common to both sets, aka intersection.</div><div>engineers = {'bob', 'sue', 'ann', 'vic'}</div><div>managers = {'tom', 'sue'}</div>	<div>managers &amp; engineers #=&gt;&nbsp;{'sue'}</div><div>or</div><div>s.intersection(t)</div>	
<div>Find all people in either sets</div><div>using set method call</div><div><br /></div><div>engineers = {'bob', 'sue', 'ann', 'vic'}</div><div>managers = {'tom', 'sue'}</div>	managers.union(engineers) #=&gt;&nbsp;{'ann', 'bob', 'sue', 'tom', 'vic'}	
<div>Find engineers who are not managers&nbsp;</div><div>using a set method call</div><div><br /></div>engineers = {'bob', 'sue', 'ann', 'vic'}<div>managers = {'tom', 'sue'}</div>	<div><div>engineers.difference(managers)&nbsp;#=&gt;&nbsp;{'vic', 'ann', 'bob'}</div></div>	
Are all managers engineers?<div><div><br /></div><div>Bonus: make true</div><div><br /></div><div>engineers = {'bob', 'sue', 'ann', 'vic'}</div><div>managers = {'tom', 'sue'}</div></div>	managers &lt;= engineers #=&gt;&nbsp;False<div>or&nbsp;</div><div>managers.issubset(engineers)</div><div><div><br /></div><div><div>engineers.add('tom')</div></div><div>managers &lt; engineers</div><div>True</div></div>	
Are bob and sue both engineers? (subset)<div><div>engineers = {'bob', 'sue', 'ann', 'vic'}</div><div>managers = {'tom', 'sue'}</div></div><div>test =&nbsp;{'bob', 'sue'}</div>	test &lt; engineers #=&gt;True	
<div>Who is in one but not both (use operator)?</div><div><br /></div><div>engineers = {'bob', 'sue', 'ann', 'vic'}</div><div>managers = {'tom', 'sue'}</div>	managers ^ engineers #=&gt; {'tom', 'vic', 'ann', 'bob'}	
weakref	<div>a standard library module</div><div><br /></div>A weak reference to an object is not enough to keep the object alive<div><br /></div><div>A primary use for weak references is to implement caches or mappings holding large objects, where it’s desired that a large object not be kept alive solely because it appears in a cache or mapping.</div>	
clear screen in Console	clear

test suite	collection of test cases, test suites, or both.<div><br /></div><div>used to aggregate tests that should be executed together.</div>	
test runner	a component which orchestrates the execution of tests and provides the outcome to the use<div><br /></div><div>The runner may use a graphical interface, a textual interface, or return a special value to indicate the results of executing the tests.</div>	
assert	base assert allowing you to write your own assertions	
check a and b are equal using assert function	assertEqual(a, b)	
check a and b are not equal	assertNotEqual(a, b)	
assert that a is in the item b	assertIn(a, b)	
check that a is not in the item b	assertNotIn(a, b)&nbsp;	
check that the value of a is False	assertFalse(a)	
check the value of a is True	assertTrue(a)	
&nbsp;check that a is of type “TYPE”	assertIsInstance(a, TYPE)&nbsp;	
check that when a is called with args that it raises ERROR	assertRaises(ERROR, a, args)&nbsp;

reduce()	<div>Apply a function of two arguments cumulatively to the items of a sequence,</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; from left to right, so as to reduce the sequence to a single value.</div><div><br /></div><div><div>&nbsp;For example, reduce(lambda x, y: x+y, [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) calculates</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; ((((1+2)+3)+4)+5).</div></div>

super(type[, object-or-type])	Return a proxy object that delegates method calls to a parent or sibling class of type. This is useful for accessing inherited methods that have been overridden in a class.&nbsp;<div><br /></div><div><div>class C(B):</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; def method(self, arg):</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; super(C, self).method(arg)</div></div><div><br /></div>

<div>How do you check if all values in an iterable are true?</div>	<div><div>all</div><div><br /></div><div>Return True if bool(x) is True for all values x in the iterable.</div><div>If the iterable is empty, return True.</div></div><div><br /></div><div>eg:</div><div><div># Find primes</div><div>def isprime(a):</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; return all(a % i for i in xrange(2,a)) # XXX: returns 1 as prime</div></div><div><br /></div>

decorator	"<div>decorators dynamically alter the functionality of a function, method or class without having to directly use subclasses.</div><div><br /></div><div>ideal when you need to extend the functionality of functions that you don't want to modify.&nbsp;</div><div><br /></div>a callable that takes a function as an argument and returns a replacement function.&nbsp;<div><br /></div><div>@ marks it, as synatic sugar</div><div><br /></div><div>eg: you have function writen by someone for ip&nbsp;</div><div>reasons, we can't change write a dector to ""improve"" the funciton"" for loop vs list compreshsion</div>"	
generator	"""generates"" values<div><br /></div><div>defined like a normal function, but whenever it needs to generate a value, it does so with the yield keyword rather than return</div>"

Name 3 ways to multiple each element in y by 2<div><br /><div>y = [1, 2, 3]</div></div>	<div>1.&nbsp;map(lambda x: x*2, y) # Functional programing</div><div><br /></div><div>2. [_*2 for _ in y] # List comprehension</div><div><br /></div>2. import numpy as np<div><br /></div><div>y = list(2 * np.array(y)) # Broadcasting</div>

import&nbsp;operator	<div>This module exports a set of functions implemented in C corresponding</div><div>to the intrinsic operators of Python.&nbsp;</div><div><br /></div><div>For example, operator.add(x, y)&nbsp;is equivalent to the expression x+y.</div><div><br /></div><div>The function names are those&nbsp;used for special methods; variants without leading and trailing&nbsp;'__' are also provided for convenience.</div>

how many columns are in Bootstrap's grid system?	12		
how many grid sizes are there, and what are their prefixes?	four: <br>.col-xs-# <br>.col-sm-#&nbsp;<br>.col-md-#&nbsp;<div>.col-lg-#<br><br>replace # with the number of columns the element takes up</div>		
What happens if you are working in the extra small columns, and the screen gets even smaller?	The extra small columns are always horizontal, they don't collapse to vertical no matter how small the screen gets. &nbsp;So in our case, the columns would get smaller and smaller, even if the content inside wont fit (it will overflow).		
What happens if you specify a column width using .col-lg-# and then the screen gets so narrow that the .col-md-# grid takes over?	"If you specified .col-md-# classes on your columns as well, then those column widths would be shown, displaying horizontally next to each other. &nbsp;<div><br></div><div>But if you only specified the .col-lg-# classes, the row will ""break"" to display your columns vertically, and each column will now take up the whole 12 columns, even if previously it only took up only 1 column.</div>"		
Which columns always stay horizontal, no matter how wide the page is?	.col-xs-#		
How do you specify that an element should only be visible at specific breakpoints?	Give the classes .visible-X, where X can be lg, md, sm, or xs. &nbsp;Useful if you want to display different content at different screen sizes.		
How do you structure a row, which has columns that span various widths of that row?	"Create a containing &lt;div&gt; with a class of ""row"" and give the containing elements column widths for the various grid sizes, making sure they add up to 12 for each grid size you want to specify.<br><br>&lt;div class=""row""&gt;<br>&nbsp; &lt;div class=""col-lg-6 col-sm-4""&gt;<div>&nbsp; &lt;/div&gt;</div><div>&nbsp; &lt;div class=""col-lg-3<span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">&nbsp;</span><span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">col-sm-4</span><span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">""&gt;</span></div><div><div>&nbsp; &lt;/div&gt;</div><div>&nbsp; &lt;div class=""col-lg-3<span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">&nbsp;</span><span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">col-sm-4</span><span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">""&gt;</span></div><div><div>&nbsp; &lt;/div&gt;</div></div>&lt;/div&gt;</div>"		
Make it so the elements in the page aren't right up against the edges of the window.	"Add a div around the content with the class ""container."""		
How do you add some spacing between the columns in a particular row?	"Use offsets:<br><br>col-&lt;size&gt;-offset-#<br><br>Where &lt;size&gt; is lg, md, sm, or xs. &nbsp;And # is the number of columns you want to appear as white space.<br><br>Be sure the total number of columns still ads up to 12. <br><br>&lt;div class=""row""&gt;<br>&nbsp; &lt;div class=""col-lg-6""&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<br>&nbsp; &lt;div class=""col-lg-5 col-lg-offset-1""&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<br>&lt;/div&gt;<br><br>6+5+1 = 12<br><br>Note: offset is always added to the left"		
What's a way to make two side-by-side elements show up in the opposite order (instead of AB, it'll show up BA within the same row).	Push the left column (toward the right), and pull the right column (toward the left). &nbsp;Make sure to specify the push and pull classes for each grid size.<br><br>Ex: if we have a 3 column element on the left and a 9 column element on the right, and we want to switch their positions in the large grid, we'd apply col-lg-push-9 to the left element and col-lg-pull-3 to the right element.		
What does it mean to nest rows?	It means taking a full 12-column row and sticking the whole thing into another .row's column element. &nbsp;It'll still add up to 12 columns, but it'll only take up the same width as its parent column.		
When do you &nbsp;not need to specify how many columns a row's elements are going to take up?	When you want that row to take up all 12 columns.		
How do you make a large, primary feature area? &nbsp;And how do you make it span the full-page?	"Add the ""jumbotron"" class to a row (use this class INSTEAD of the row class).<div><br></div><div><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""jumbotron""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;h1&gt;</span>Hello, world!<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/h1&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;p&gt;</span>...<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/p&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;p&gt;&lt;a</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""btn btn-primary btn-lg""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">role=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""button""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>Learn more<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt;</span></code></pre><br>To make it show full-width, place it outside all .containers and instead add a .container within:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""jumbotron""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""container""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>     ...   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt;</span></code></pre></div>"		
What are the float: right an float: left classes in Bootstrap?	pull-right and pull-left		
"Class to make a paragraph's text slightly larger and more ""stand out,"" like the first paragraph in an article?"	"add the ""lead"" class"		
How do you make text smaller and lighter, like disclaimer text at the bottom of a page?	&lt;small&gt;content&lt;/small&gt;		
What are the text-alignment classes?	text-left<br>text-center<br>text-right<br>text-justify		
"How to add an author to your blockquote? &nbsp;By default it shows up with a ""-"" in front of their name, and in light gray."	"<pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">Use the &lt;footer&gt; tag.  &lt;blockquote&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;p&gt;</span>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer posuere erat a ante.<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/p&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;footer&gt;</span>Someone famous in <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;cite</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">title=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""Source Title""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>Source Title<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/cite&gt;&lt;/footer&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/blockquote&gt;</span></code></pre>"		
How do you make a horizontal definition list, so the definition shows up to the right of the term that needs to be defined?	"Add the ""dl-horizontal"" clas to the &lt;dl&gt; element:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;dl</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""dl-horizontal""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;dt&gt;</span>...<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/dt&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;dd&gt;</span>...<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/dd&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/dl&gt;</span></code></pre>"		
What are the various classes to make an element hidden/visible at various grid sizes?	.visible-&lt;size&gt;<br>.hidden-&lt;size&gt;<br><br>where &lt;size&gt; is xs, sm, md, or lg<br><br>Note: When hiding an element, it is just applying display: none, so the browser is still downloading the element. &nbsp;Use server-side or javascript techniques to prevent the element from downloading at all at certain screen sizes, if performance is super important to your application.		
What class is required for all buttons, but doesn't do anything by itself?	btn<br><br><div>Make sure you include at least one more class, like btn-default, btn-primary, etc.</div>		
How to specify the size of a button?	add the classes btn-&lt;size&gt;<br><br>where &lt;size&gt; can be the xs, sm, md, lg, or block<br><br>btn-block will make the button span all the way across its containing element.		
How do you make images responsive with Bootstrap?	"Add the class ""img-responsive"" to each of the &lt;img /&gt; tags."		
How do you make an image into a circle?	add the class img-circle to the &lt;img /&gt; tag		
How to give an image rounded corners?	"add the calss ""img-rounded"""		
How to make a white-background image stand out against a white background?	Add the class img-thumbnail to your image. &nbsp;By default, this ads a thin gray border around the element.		
"What are ""glyphicons"" and how do you add them to an element?"	"They are vector graphics that ship with Bootstrap that scale just like fonts so you can add responsive images to your designs (like arrows, push pins, etc).<br><br>To add one to an element, add two classes, ""glyphicon"" and ""glyphicon-X"" where X is the name of the glyphicon. Ex:<br><br>&lt;span class=""glyphicon glyphicon-pushpin""&gt;&lt;/span&gt;"		
"What are ""glyphicons"" and how do you add them to an element?"	"They are vector graphics that ship with Bootstrap that scale just like fonts so you can add responsive images to your designs (like arrows, push pins, etc).<br><br>To add one to an element, add two classes, ""glyphicon"" and ""glyphicon-X"" where X is the name of the glyphicon. Ex:<br><br>&lt;span class=""glyphicon glyphicon-pushpin""&gt;&lt;/span&gt;"		
How to style a table with Bootstrap? &nbsp;What are some options, and how do you make it responsive?	"Add the ""table"" class to the &lt;table&gt; tag. &nbsp;Here are some optional classes you can add in addition to ""table"":<br><br>table-striped &nbsp;(alternating row colors)<br>table-bordered (looks like a spreadsheet)<br>table-hover &nbsp;(ads mouse-over effects)<br>table-condensed &nbsp;(reduces padding)<br><br>To make the table responsive, so the tabular data can scroll as the screen gets smaller, rather than getting crushed and falling out of their cells, add a &lt;div&gt; around the table with a class of ""table-responsive."""		
How do you override Bootstrap styles?	Create a new .css file, make sure its &lt;link&gt; in the &lt;head&gt; is after Bootstrap's &lt;link&gt; so your styles overwrite Bootstrap's files.<br><br>Next, write your custom CSS in this new stylesheet. &nbsp;Copy the selectors using Firebug/Developer Tools, paste them into your new file, and specify the parts you want to overwrite. &nbsp;Ex:<br><br>.glyphicon{<br>&nbsp; color: green;<br>}<br>.glyphicon-heart{<br>&nbsp; color: red;<br>}<br><br>This will make all the glyphicons green, except for the heart glyphicon, which will be red. &nbsp;By default, these images were the color of your font.		
What are the contextual classes, and what do they do?	"<table class=""table table-bordered table-striped"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; border-collapse: collapse; border-spacing: 0px; max-width: 100%; width: 720px; margin-bottom: 20px; border: 1px solid rgb(221, 221, 221); How do make three distinct buttons turn into a series of buttons, so they look like a single button split into three mini buttons?	"Wrap the three &lt;button&gt; elements in a &lt;div class=""btn-group""&gt;<br><br>Make sure your &lt;button&gt; tags have proper button classes, such as ""btn btn-default"""		
How to make all the buttons in a button group the same size?	"Specify the size on the .btn-group class, like this:<br><br>&lt;div class=""btn-group btn-group-lg""&gt;<br>&nbsp; ....buttons go here...<br>&lt;/div&gt;"		
How do you make a button group appear vertically instead of horizontally?	"&lt;div class=""btn-group-vertical""&gt;<br>&nbsp; &nbsp;... buttons go here ...<br><div>&lt;/div&gt;</div>"		
Create a dropdown as one of the buttons within your button group.	"Nest a btn-group within the current btn-group, like so:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;button</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">type=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""button""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""btn btn-default""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>1<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/button&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;button</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""btn btn-default""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>2<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/button&gt;</span>    <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""btn-group""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>     <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;button</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">type=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""button""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""btn btn-default dropdown-toggle""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">data-toggle=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""dropdown""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>       Dropdown       <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; "How do you create a ""single button dropdown"" (a dropdown that's a button)?"	"You need to create a btn-group with a &lt;button&gt; that has a class of ""dropdown-toggle"", then nest an unordered list inside the btn-gruop with a class of ""dropdown-menu"" and role of ""menu"" inside, after the &lt;button&gt;. &nbsp;You should also add a caret inside the content of the button to signify that it is a dropdown. &nbsp;Ex:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""btn-group""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">data-toggle=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""dropdown""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>     Action <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;span</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""caret""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/button&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;ul</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""dropdown-menu""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">role=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""menu""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>     <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>Action<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;</span>     <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;li&gt;&lt;a</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">href=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""#""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt;</span></code></pre>"		
What classes specify the size of a button?	btn-&lt;size&gt;<br><br>Where &lt;size&gt; = xs, sm, md, or lg.		
"How do you append or prepend elements to a single form control? (like putting a ""go"" button directly at the end of a text box, as a way to search the site)?"	"Use .input-group with an .input-group-addon (or .input-group-btn) to append or prepend a single .form-control.<br><br>This example will ad a fancy $ to the beginning and a fancy .00 to the end of the amount typed into the text field:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""input-group""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;span</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""input-group-addon""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>$<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/span&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;input</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt; </span></code></pre><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);""><br></span></code></pre>And this will put the ""go"" button at the end of the search text field. &nbsp;In this case, use .input-group-btn instead of .input-group-addon:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; elements.</div>"

How do you specify a panel header, title, and footer, in addition to the primary content of the panel?	"<pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; background-color: transparent;"">Panel footer</span><span class=""nt"" style=""font-size: inherit; line-height: 1.42857143; box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159); background-color: transparent;"">&lt;/div&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""color: rgb(47, 111, 159); box-sizing: border-box;"">&lt;/div&gt;</span></code></pre>"		
Force an element to be shown or hidden (including from screen readers).	Use .show and .hidden &nbsp;(the use of .hide is depreciated).<br><br>Using .invisible will make the element invisible, but it'll still take up space in the document and be visible to screen readers.		
How to clear a float so it doesn't collapse, and instead contains all of the floated elements?	"Use the ""clearfix"" class on the element that contains the floated elements."		
How do you make breadcrumbs with Bootstrap?&nbsp;	"create an ordered list with a class of ""breadcrumb"". &nbsp;You can add the ""active"" class to the &lt;li&gt; that is active, if you wish.<br>"		
How do you make a navigation bar with Bootstrap?	"Put the &lt;ul&gt; in a &lt;div class=""row""&gt;. &nbsp;Next, add a class of ""nav"" on your &lt;ul&gt;. &nbsp;At this point you'll have a vertically-oriented list of links.<br><br>If you want it to look like tabs, add the class ""nav-tabs"" to the &lt;ul&gt;. &nbsp;Add ""active"" to the &lt;li&gt; that's active. &nbsp;<br><br>To use navigation ""pills"" instead of tabs, use nav-pills instead of nav-tabs on your &lt;ul&gt;.<br><br>To make your navigation justified across the page, add the class ""nav-justified."""		
"How do you add and use Bootstrap's navbar? (which turns into a ""menu button"" at smaller screen widths)"	"Refer to the documentation. &nbsp;It's a bit too involved to go through something like an Anki flashcard. &nbsp;<div><br></div><div>&lt;a href=""http://getbootstrap.com/components/#navbar""&gt;http://getbootstrap.com/components/#navbar&lt;/a&gt;<br><div><br></div><div>In a nutshell, you wrap your navigation links in a &lt;nav class=""navbar navbar-default"" role=""navigation""&gt;, then specify what you want in the mobile view inside a &lt;div class=""navbar-header""&gt; (like the brand and the ""expand menu"" &lt;button&gt;). &nbsp;The button needs a class of ""navbar-toggle"" and a data-target attribute, which points to the ID of the element that's getting collapsed and expanded when someone presses the button. &nbsp;Finally, you add the &lt;div class=""collapse navbar-collapse""&gt; with an ID that matches what you set above. &nbsp;That's the content that'll get shown and hidden when someone presses the button.<br><br>But really, check out the documentation. &nbsp;It involves too much code to copy/paste here.</div></div>"		
What class do you add to an element if you only want it visible to screen readers? (like helper text)	sr-only		
How do you add a little arrow to a button or other element to visually indicate that it's a dropdown?	"Inside of the element, insert a &lt;span class=""caret"" /&gt;"		
How do you create a dropdown within your (unordered list) navigation?	"<div><span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">Add the ""dropdown"" class to the top-level &lt;li&gt;, add the ""dropdown-menu"" to the nested &lt;ul&gt;, and add a data-toggle attribute to the &lt;a&gt; inside the &lt;li&gt; in which you nested the dropdown, setting it equal to ""dropdown"", like so:</span><br></div><div><br>&lt;ul&gt;<br>&nbsp; &lt;li class=""dropdown""&gt;&lt;a href=""#"" data-toggle=""dropdown"" /&gt; About Us<div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ul class=""dropdown-menu""&gt;</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;li&gt;...&lt;/li&gt;</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;li&gt;...&lt;/li&gt;</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/ul&gt;</div><div>&nbsp; &lt;/li&gt;</div><div>&nbsp; &lt;li&gt;<span style=""line-height: 1.1;"">...&lt;/li&gt;</span></div><div>&lt;/ul&gt;<br><br>Note: this dropdown responds to clicks, not mouse hovers, because in mobile there is no hover. &nbsp;It also means the top-level menu item is not clickable (only its sub-menu items are clickable).</div></div>"		
How do you make tooltips with Bootstrap?	"1. &nbsp;Add a title attribute to the link. &nbsp;This will be the text that shows up in the tooltip.<div>2. &nbsp;Add the following attribute to the link: data-toggle=""tooltip""<br>3. &nbsp;To initialize the tooltips, you need to use jQuery. &nbsp;On $(document).ready, select your links and run .tooltip(). &nbsp;For example:<br><br>$('.myTooltipLinks').tooltip();</div>"		
What do all the JavaScript plugins of Bootstrap require?	jQuery		
What's the &lt;meta&gt; tag you should include in the &lt;head&gt; of your document if you want your Bootstrap page to be responsive?	"<pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;meta</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">name=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""viewport""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">content=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""width=device-width, initial-scale=1""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span></code></pre>"		
What additional resource do you need to load to make sure Bootstrap's JavaScript is compatible with IE8?	"Respond.js<br><br>Which you can get&nbsp;&lt;a href=""https://github.com/scottjehl/Respond/blob/master/src/respond.js""&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;"		
Can you make it so that Bootstrap is non-responsive?	"Yes. &nbsp;Follow the instructions &lt;a href=""http://getbootstrap.com/getting-started/#disable-responsive""&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;."		
Which versions of IE support Bootstrap?	8+ &nbsp;(or 9+ if you don't include respond.js)		
Can you use a non-HTML5 &lt;doctype&gt; with Bootstrap?	"No. &nbsp;If you do, you'll lose some functionality. &nbsp;Make sure to start your projects with:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""cp"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(0, 153, 153);"">&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;html</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">lang=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""en""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   ... <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/html&gt;</span></code></pre>"		
For improved cross-browser rendering, what does Bootstrap recommend you use in your project?	"Normalize.css<br><br>You can get it &lt;a href=""http://necolas.github.io/normalize.css/""&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;."		
Are .container elements nestable?	No, not by default.		
Bootstrap's grid rows must be placed within what in order to align properly?	The need to be in a .container element, or .container-fluid element.		
Only THESE may be the immediate children of row elements.	Columns		
What's between the Bootstrap columns?	They're separated by padding. &nbsp;The additional padding is offset by negative margins on the .row elements.		
What are the screen widths that trigger the breakpoints between xs, sm, md, and lg grids?	xs (phones): width under 768px<div>sm (tablets): width 768px and up</div><div>md (desktops): width 992px and up</div><div>lg (large desktops): width 1200px and up</div>		
How does the container width compare to the screen width?	"In all cases, it's a bit smaller. &nbsp;For example, the container width for large desktops is 1170px, even though the breakpoint for the lg grid is 1200. &nbsp;The only size without a container width is xs, which has a width of ""auto""."		
How do you turn a fixed-width grid layout into a fluid full-width layout, so the width of the container and its columns are not fixed.	"Use the ""container-fluid"" class instead of the ""container"" class on the container &lt;div&gt;."		
what should you do to your form elements to ensure their labels and spacing look as they should?	"wrap the input and their labels (and helper text) with &lt;div class=""form-group"" /&gt;<br><br><div>Note: don't mix form groups directly with input-groups. &nbsp;Instead, nest the input group inside of the form-group.</div>"		
How wide are inputs, selects, and textareas by default in Bootstrap?	width: 100%		
"What do you use the class ""form-control"" for?"	Use it on all textual &lt;input&gt; elements (text, password, url, etc), &lt;textarea&gt;, and &lt;select&gt; elements within a &lt;form&gt; element. &nbsp;You don't need to use it on these elements if they're not part of a form, and you don't need to use it on elements like radio buttons or checkboxes.&nbsp;		
What are the classes you can add to .form-group elements to make their respective inputs and labels change styles to indicate that there's an error, have a warning, or are correctly formatted?	add one of the following classes to the .form-group div, which wraps the input and its label:<br><br>has-success<br>has-warning<br>has-error		
How do you add a check mark, warning triangle, or error X (or any other glyphicon) to the end of a validated input?	"1. &nbsp;Make sure your input has the class form-control<br>2. &nbsp;Make sure your input, its label, and its helper text is surrounded by a form-group, which has the appropriate validation class getting applied (has-succes, has-warning, or has-error)<br>3. &nbsp;Finally, add a &lt;span&gt; after the input with a class of the glyphicon you'er looking for and ""form-control-feedback""<br><br>Here's an example with three inputs:<br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""form-group has-success has-feedback""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;label</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""control-label""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">for=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""inputSuccess2""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>Input with success<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/label&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;input</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">type=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""text""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""form-control""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">id=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""inputSuccess2""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;span</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""glyphicon glyphicon-ok form-control-feedback""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""form-group has-warning has-feedback""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;label</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;input</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">type=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""text""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""form-control""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">id=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""inputWarning2""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;span</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""glyphicon glyphicon-warning-sign form-control-feedback""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;div</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""form-group has-error has-feedback""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;label</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""form-control""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">id=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""inputError2""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>   <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;span</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""glyphicon glyphicon-remove form-control-feedback""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/div&gt;</span></code></pre>"		
Since inputs have their width set to 100% by default, how do you change how wide they are?	Use the grid system.		
How do you add helper text below your form inputs?	"Add a &lt;span class=""help-block""&gt;Helper text here&lt;/span&gt; below the input."		
"What are the pre-set button styles that you use in addition to the ""btn"" class?"	btn-default<br>btn-primary<br>btn-success<br>btn-info<br>btn-warning<br>btn-danger<br>btn-link (looks like a link)		
"What happens if you put the classes ""btn btn-primary"" on a &lt;button&gt; vs. a &lt;a&gt; tag?"	They look and act pretty much the same.		
On which elements can you add the button classes?	&lt;a&gt;, &lt;button&gt;, and &lt;input&gt;	
What classes can you add to paragraphs to change their background colors to give them more meaning (success, info, etc)	bg-primary<br>bg-success<br>bg-info<br>bg-info<br>bg-warning<br>bg-danger	
"How do you code a generic ""close"" button for things like modals?"	"<pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;button</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">type=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""button""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""close""</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">aria-hidden=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""true""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span><span class=""ni"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(153, 153, 153);"">&amp;times;</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/button&gt;</span></code></pre>"	
What class do you add to an element to center it on the page and center its content?	center-block	
How do you implement the image replacement technique, so screen readers read text, while on the screen you see only the element's background image?	"add the ""text-hide"" class to the element that has the background image (like a logo)"	
Can you add glypicon classes to elements other than &lt;span&gt;?	No. &nbsp;Nest a &lt;span&gt; with the proper classes inside the element where you're trying to add the glyphicon.	
How do you make a dropdown (not necessarily one in a menu)?	"<span style=""color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 20px;"">Wrap the dropdown's trigger (a button in the example below) and the dropdown menu within&nbsp;</span><code style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 2px 4px; color: rgb(199, 37, 78); white-space: nowrap; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; background-color: rgb(249, 242, 244);"">.dropdown</code><span style=""color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 20px;"">, or another element that declares</span><code style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 2px 4px; color: rgb(199, 37, 78); white-space: nowrap; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; background-color: rgb(249, 242, 244);"">position: relative;</code><span style=""color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 20px;"">. Then add the menu's HTML.<br><br>&lt;div class=""dropdown""&gt;<br>&lt;button class=""btn dropdown-toggle /&gt;</span><div><span style=""color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 20px;"">&lt;ul class=""dropdown""&gt; ... &lt;/ul&gt;<br>&lt;/div&gt;</span></div>"	
How do you add headers to the different sections of a dropdown menu?	"Within the menu's &lt;ul class=""dropdown-menu""&gt;, give one of the &lt;li&gt; elements a class of ""dropdown-header"""	
When you implement a navbar, you'll notice that the rest of the content of the page is now under the navbar. &nbsp;How do you fix this?	Add some padding-top to the &lt;body&gt;.	
How to make a pagination page selector?	"<pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;ul</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""pagination""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; "How to quickly set up ""next"" and ""previous"" buttons?"	"<pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; How to quickly style something like # of unread messages?	"Use badges. &nbsp;For example, to show Inbox 42 (where 42 is in a styled circle) use:<br><br><pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143; word-break: break-all; word-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); border: 0px; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: transparent;""><code class=""html"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: inherit; padding: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; border-top-left-radius: 0px; border-top-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-right-radius: 0px; border-bottom-left-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;""><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;a</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">href=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""#""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>Inbox <span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;span</span> <span class=""na"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(79, 159, 207);"">class=</span><span class=""s"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(212, 73, 80);"">""badge""</span><span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&gt;</span>42<span class=""nt"" style=""box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(47, 111, 159);"">&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;</span></code></pre>"	
"How to make an alert message to display after doing something like submitting a form (to say ""success!"" or ""We found errors!"")"	"<pre style=""box-sizing: border-box; overflow: auto; font-family: Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; padding: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; line-height: 1.42857143;
